sprite.name: Mini Goomba
sprite.notes: A Tiny Goomba that will walk forward and die upon contact with the player.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-Order of the Goomba placing it further behind other sprites.

sprite.name: !-Switch
sprite.notes: This switch is similar to the ? Switch, but it has the additional effect of changing all outlined Red Blocks (Pa0 Object 57) into solid Red Blocks. This also applies to any outlined Red Blocks spawned by a Tile God. This additional functionality only occurs when using the Timed Event mode, but a Target Event is not required to make use of this functionality.

list.title: Switch Type
list.comment: This determines the color of switch and what block outlines will be actived.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will be facing downwards.
checkbox.comment2: Upside-Down switches cannot be set to fall.

checkbox.title: Falls
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will be movable by environmental factors, such as dropping down when bricks below it are destroyed, or moving along platforms.
checkbox.comment2: Conveyor belts cannot move Switches, even when [Falls] is set.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: This event will be modified when the switch is pressed. An event is not required if simply using the switch to activate Red Blocks.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is modified.
dualbox.comment2: The Target Event will be modified to the opposite state when the Timed effect expires.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is modified.
This determines if the Target Event is modified temporarily or permanently.
dualbox.comment2: Permanent Event cannot be used with Multi-Use. Additionally, Permanent Event will also permanently deactivate the background music for the zone, and Red Blocks will not become solid.

checkbox.title: Disable Music Interruption
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will not interrupt the normal level music with Timed music. This setting is only applicable if Timed Event is set.

checkbox.title: Disable Permanent Music Interruption
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will not disable the background music. This setting is highly recommended if Permanent Event is set.

dualbox.comment: This determines if the switch will pop back up when the Timed effect expires.
dualbox.comment2:
Single Use: The switch will vanish entirely after pressed.

Multi-Use: The switch will enter a flat state. When the Timed effect expires, the switch will pop back up following the Delay setting.
dualbox.advancedcomment:
If the Target Event is deactivated/activated by another method, Multi-Use switches will flatten or pop-up on their own.

The pop up effect can be used to launch the player much higher than they could normally jump.

list.title: Delay on Multi-Use
list.comment: This determines how long the switch will take to pop up after the timer expires on a Timed Multi-Use switch.

checkbox.title: Loads at Midway
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will only appear if the level has been loaded from a Midway point.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This switch will not be visible if a Triggering Event is defined unless that event is activated.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This switch will not be visible if a Triggering Event is defined unless that event is activated.
value.advancedcomment: Using a Triggering ID with Multi-Use functionality is somewhat glitchy and not recommended.

sprite.name: Brick Block !-Switch
sprite.notes: This switch, stored inside a Brick Block, is similar to the ? Switch, but it has the additional effect of causing all outlined Red Blocks (Pa0 Object 57) into solid Red Blocks. This also applies to any outlined Red Blocks spawned by a Tile God. This additional functionality only occurs when using the Timed Event mode, but a Target Event is not required to make use of this functionality.
sprite.advancednotes: A brick block containing or supporting a switch cannot be destroyed by sprites that destroy normal brick and solid blocks as long as the switch exists.

dependency.notes: Add Tileset / Puzzle dependency information relating to custom tileset settings.

list.title: Switch Type
list.comment: This determines the color of switch and what block outlines will be actived.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will forcibly spawn on the underside of the block facing down, even if struck from below.
checkbox.comment2: Brick-Block switches cannot be set to fall, even if Upside-Down is unchecked.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: This event will be modified when the switch is pressed. An event is not required if simply using the switch to activate Red Blocks.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is modified.
dualbox.comment2: The Target Event will be modified to the opposite state when the Timed effect expires.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is modified.
This determines if the Target Event is modified temporarily or permanently.
dualbox.comment2: Permanent Event cannot be used with Multi-Use. Additionally, Permanent Event will also permanently deactivate the background music for the zone, and Red Blocks will not become solid.

checkbox.title: Disable Music Interruption
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will not interrupt the normal level music with Timed music. This setting is only applicable if Timed Event is set.

checkbox.title: Disable Permanent Music Interruption
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will not disable the background music. This setting is highly recommended if Permanent Event is set.

dualbox.comment: This determines if the switch will pop back up when the Timed effect expires.
dualbox.comment2:
Single Use: The switch will vanish entirely after pressed.

Multi-Use: The switch will enter a flat state. When the Timed effect expires, the switch will pop back up following the Delay setting.
dualbox.advancedcomment:
If the Target Event is deactivated/activated by another method, Multi-Use switches will flatten or pop-up on their own.

The pop up effect can be used to launch the player much higher than they could normally jump.

list.title: Delay on Multi-Use
list.comment: This determines how long the switch will take to pop up after the timer expires on a Timed Multi-Use switch.

checkbox.title: Loads at Midway
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will only appear if the level has been loaded from a Midway point.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This switch will not be visible if a Triggering Event is defined unless that event is activated.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This switch will not be visible if a Triggering Event is defined unless that event is activated.
value.advancedcomment: Using a Triggering ID with Multi-Use functionality is somewhat glitchy and not recommended.

sprite.name: Tile God Event
sprite.notes: The Tile God can Create / Change / Destroy tiles within a specified area when an Event is activated.

dependency.notes: The Tile God sprite can be placed no more than one block outside of the Zone it is being activated in for it to function.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When this Event ID is activated, the tiles affected by the Tile God's area will be created or destroyed, depending on the Mode.

value.title: Width
value.comment: This determines the width of the area that is affected.

value.title: Height
value.comment: This determines the height of the area that is affected.

list.title: Target Layer
list.comment: This determines which terrain layer is affected.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Tile God will act when the Triggering Event is activated.
dualbox.comment2: When creating, the Tile God will place these tiles on top of existing tiles instead of replacing them.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Tile God will act when the Triggering Event is deactivated
dualbox.comment2: When set to Reverse, previously created tiles will be destroyed, and locations where tiles were destroyed will be filled by the creation settings of the Tile God.

checkbox.title: Disable Effects
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the visual effect for Tile Creation/Destruction will be removed.
checkbox.comment2: You can use the Effect/Sound Spawner (483) to add your own effect in its place.

checkbox.title: Disable Sounds
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the sound effect for Tile Creation/Destruction will be removed.
checkbox.comment2: You can use the Effect/Sound Spawner (483) to add your own sound in its place.

list.title: Pattern
list.comment: This determines the fill pattern for the Tile God's selected area.
list.comment2: A checkered pattern and reverse checked pattern overlapping will create the same effect as a regular fill. This is sometimes useful for its visual effect.

list.title: Shard Effect
list.comment: This determines what shard spawns when the block is destroyed. If none, it will spawn the original poof effect.

list.title: Tile
list.comment: This determines what terrain tile will appear at the Tile God's selected area

value.title: Tileset Row
value.comment: When using [Tile: Tile from Pa(x)], you can spawn every tile from the tileset by selecting it from a grid formation. Each tileset contains 16 Rows (0-15), and 16 Columns (0-15). The first tile in the top left is 0,0 and the last tile in the bottom right is 15,15.
value.comment2:
Some common examples for Pa0:
Coin: 1,14 | Coin Outline: 1,15 | ?-Block: 3,1 | Used Block: 3,2 | Wooden Block: 3,3 | Stone Block: 3,4 | Donut Lift: 3,5 | Steel Block: 3,6

value.title: Tileset Column
value.comment: When using [Block Type: Tile from Pa(x)], you can spawn every tile from the tileset by selecting it from a grid formation. Each tileset contains 16 Rows (0-15), and 16 Columns (0-15). The first tile in the top left is 0,0 and the last tile in the bottom right is 15,15.
value.comment2:
Some common examples for Pa0:
Coin: 1,14 | Coin Outline: 1,15 | ?-Block: 3,1 | Used Block: 3,2 | Wooden Block: 3,3 | Stone Block: 3,4 | Donut Lift: 3,5 | Steel Block: 3,6

sprite.name: Rotation Controlled Coin
sprite.notes: A standard coin that can be paired with rotation controllers. It does not have any additional features like [147] Coin.

dependency.notes: This coin does not function and cannot be collected unless actually paired to a rotation controller.

checkbox.title: Always Upright
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the coin will remain upright regardless of its rotation.
checkbox.comment2: This option will not work with 'Tilted Coin' enabled.

checkbox.title: Tilted Coin
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the bottom of the coin will always face the paired rotation controller.

list.title: Forced Rotation
list.comment: This determines the rotation that the coin will always be set to, regardless of it being rotated. This overrides the 'Always Upright' and 'Tilted Coin' options.

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: This pairs the Coin to a matching rotation controller.

sprite.name: Jumbo Ray Respawner 2
sprite.notes: A controller that will respawn or otherwise spawn additional Jumbo Rays.

value.title: Ray ID
value.comment: This determines which Jumbo Rays will be respawned by this controller.

value.title: Spawn Delay While Ridden
value.comment: This determines how soon after the launch of the initial Jumbo Ray that another one will be spawned. Used whenever at least one Ray is being ridden by a player.
value.comment2: A value of 16 is equal to about the width of one Jumbo Ray. <font color="red">Do not use a value of 0 or the game will crash.</font>

value.title: Spawn Delay While Not Ridden
value.comment: Used instead of the other Spawn Delay whenever no Rays are currently being ridden.

sprite.name: Rotating Wooden Airship Wheel
sprite.notes: A circular wheel matching the standard airship decor that rotates, making it hard to stand on.

list.title: Size
list.comment: This determines the size of the wheel.

checkbox.title: Does Not Rotate
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the wheel will remain stationary.

dualbox.comment: This determines the direction the wheel will rotate in.

value.title: Speed
value.comment: This determines the speed of the wheel's rotation. A speed of 0 still moves, just very slowly.

sprite.name: Climbing Koopa - Cliffs
sprite.notes: Koopas that hang from cliff edges and shimmy across them.
sprite.advancednotes: This sprite's constructor (and the sprite settings) was removed from the vanilla game and has been restored. There may have been more settings for this sprite at one point.

dualbox.comment: This determines if the Cliff Koopa will mindlessly walk off of ledges or if it will turn around when it reaches a ledge.
dualbox.comment2: This also changes the color of the Cliff Koopa.

dualbox.comment: This determines what direction the Cliff Koopa will spawn.

checkbox.title: Spawn Locaton Fix
checkbox.comment: by default, this sprite is placed too low to be useful. This setting will spawn them properly.

sprite.name: Signboard - Arrow
sprite.notes: A signboard with a red arrow on it, useful for suggesting a player travel in a specific direction.

list.title: Rotation
list.comment: This determines which direction the sign will face.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: This determines which direction the arrow will point in.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-Order of the Signboard placing it further behind other sprites.

sprite.name: Actor Spawner
sprite.notes: Spawns an actor on event trigger.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: Triggered by event number value+1.

external.title: Actor ID
external.comment: Can only spawn actors with ID values 0-1023.

sprite.name: Actor Multi Spawner
sprite.notes: Spawns an actor every 3 seconds while an event is triggered.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: Triggered by event number value+1.

external.title: Actor ID
external.comment: Can only spawn actors with ID values 0-1023.

sprite.name: Paired Actor Spawner
sprite.notes: Spawns an actor on event trigger. When the triggered event is disabled, the actor will despawn.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: Triggered by event number value+1.

external.title: Actor ID
external.comment: Can only spawn actors with ID values 0-1023.

sprite.name: Basic Platform - Water
sprite.notes: This platform floats on water. Can follow the current set by sprite 243.
sprite.advancenotes: Does not work with location water.

sprite.name: Shy Guy
sprite.notes: A walking Shy Guy. Can be set to turn at ledges, pace a specified distance, sleep, or bounce up and down.

list.title: Type
list.comment: Types greater than 4 spawn Shy Guys that won't move.

list.title: Color
list.comment2: While you can set Shy Guys to any color, it is recommended to keep Shy Guy types and colors consistent.

checkbox.title: Dies in 2 Stomps
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this causes the Shy Guy to die in 2 stomps instead of 1.
checkbox.comment2: It is recommended to keep this consistent across Shy Guy variants.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-order of the Shy Guy placing it further behind other sprites.

value.title: Distance
value.comment: The distance the Shy Guy will walk in each direction. The Shy Guy will ignore ledges.

sprite.name: Flip Block
sprite.notes: A yellow block with two eyes that can be destroyed by spin jumps. When struck, it will spin, allowing passage through it for a limited time.

list.title: Block Contains
list.comment: This determines what item the block contains.
list.comment2: This block will release only one power-up item.

checkbox.title: Indestructible
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Flip Block will not be destroyed when Spin Jumped.
checkbox.comment2: It is recommended to keep this consistent across Flip Blocks.

sprite.name: Event Controller - ON/OFF Block
sprite.notes: A red or blue block that, when struck, will affect the state of the Target Event(s). Events that are deactivated will become activated, and those that are activated will become deactivated.

dualbox.comment: This determines which associated Event IDs will be affected when the block is struck.
dualbox.comment2:
If set to Affect Event 1, Event 1 will be activated or deactivated and the color of the block will display the state of Event 1, red for on and blue for off.

If set to Swap Events, Event 2 will be activated initially and Event 1 will be deactivated initially during the Zone loading. The color of the block will rely on Event 2's current state.

sprite.name: Nipper Plant
sprite.notes: A small plant resembling a muncher with a white head that will jump to reach players above.

dualbox.comment: This determines if the Nipper Plant will stay in place or move around.
dualbox.comment2: The plant will still jump to the player no matter the movement type.

list.title: Jump Height
list.comment: The Nipper Plant will always have the same detection radius (6 tiles).

checkbox.title: Spits Fire
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Nipper Plant will spit fireballs when the player is nearby.

checkbox.title: Frozen
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Nipper Plant will spawn frozen. It can be thawed with a fireball.

sprite.name: Message Block
sprite.notes: A block that the player can hit which will display a custom message. Messages are defined in Message.arc.

value.title: Message ID
value.comment: Messages defined in Message.arc.
value.comment2: The category for the title is 400. The category for the text is 401. The ID is the last 2 digits of the message entry.

sprite.name: Bomb Bro
sprite.notes: A standard Brothers enemy that throws bombs at the player.

sprite.name: Event Controller - Bah Activation
sprite.notes: This sprite will activate/deactivate an event for every bah in the level music.

list.title: Bah Type
list.comment: This is a bitfield, so the number of bahs is not the decimal value.
list.comment2: Value 4 is checked by Koopas, figure out what bah type it correlates to.

sprite.name: Event Controller - Inverter
sprite.notes: This sprite will invert the value of the target event when the triggering event is activated.

sprite.name: Splunkin
sprite.notes: A walking pumpkin that takes two stomps to defeat.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-Order of the Splunkin placing it further behind other sprites.

list.title: Load-In Animation
list.comment: This value affects the spawning animation of the Splunkin. This is useful for Splunkins within range of a nearby Entrance. Jumps and Tumble will result in it landing on the platform below where it was initially placed.

sprite.name: Mega Splunkin
sprite.notes: A giant walking pumpkin that takes three stomps to defeat.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-Order of the Mega Splunkin placing it further behind other sprites.

list.title: Load-In Animation
list.comment: This value affects the spawning animation of the Splunkin. This is useful for Splunkins within range of a nearby Entrance. Jumps and Tumble will result in it landing on the platform below where it was initially placed.

sprite.name: Jack O'Goomba
sprite.notes: A Goomba with a pumpkin shield on it's head. It will emit lingering flames occasionally. The pumpkin can only be broken with a spin jump.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-order of the Jack O'Goomba placing it further behind other sprites.

list.title: Load-In Animation
list.comment: This value affects the spawning animation of the Jack O'Goomba. This is useful for Jack O'Goomba within range of a nearby Entrance. Jumps and Tumble will result in it landing on the platform below where it was initially placed.

sprite.name: Goombrat
sprite.notes: A sub-species of a Goomba which stays on platforms.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-order of the Goombrat placing it further behind other sprites.

list.title: Load-In Animation
list.comment: This value affects the spawning animation of the Goombrat. This is useful for Goombrats within range of a nearby Entrance. Jumps and Tumble will result in it landing on the platform below where it was initially placed.

sprite.name: Galoomba
sprite.notes: A sub-species of a Goomba that resists being stomped.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-order of the Galoomba placing it further behind other sprites.

list.title: Load-In Animation
list.comment: This value affects the spawning animation of the Galoomba. This is useful for Galoombas within range of a nearby Entrance. Jumps and Tumble will result in it landing on the platform below where it was initially placed.

sprite.name: Para-Galoomba
sprite.notes: A sub-species of a Goomba that resists being stomped with wings that will flutter towards Mario when it loads.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-order of the Galoomba placing it further behind other sprites.

sprite.name: Goombud
sprite.notes: A sub-species of a Goomba that resists being stomped and will turn at ledges.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-order of the Goombud placing it further behind other sprites.

list.title: Load-In Animation
list.comment: This value affects the spawning animation of the Goombud. This is useful for Goombuds within range of a nearby Entrance. Jumps and Tumble will result in it landing on the platform below where it was initially placed.

sprite.name: Bubble/Balloon Shy Guy
sprite.notes: A walking Shy Guy in a floating bubble/balloon. Will start walking when popped

list.title: Type
list.notes: Types greater than 4 spawn Shy Guys that won't move.

dualbox.comment: This determines what the Shy Guy will float around with.

checkbox.title: Pops when Above Player
checkbox.comment: The Shy Guy's bubble will pop when above the player when this is enabled.

value.title: Movement Distance
value.comment: The distance the bubble/balloon will travel in each direction.

checkbox.title: Dies in 2 Stomps
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this causes the Shy Guy to die in 2 stomps instead of 1.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-order of the Shy Guy placing it further behind other sprites.

value.title: Distance
value.comment: The distance the Shy Guy will walk in each direction. The Shy Guy will ignore ledges.

sprite.name: Climbing Shy Guy
sprite.notes: A Shy guy that climbs on wire fences. The Shy guy can punch the player if on the other side of the fence.

checkbox.title: Attacks
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Shy Guy will attempt to punch the other side of the Chainlink Fence if the player is on the other side.

checkbox.title: Starts Behind Fence
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Shy Guy will be placed on the reverse side of the Chainlink Fence.

sprite.name: Magic Platform - Path Controlled
sprite.notes: A path controlled platform made out of tile objects.

dependency.notes: It should be noted that the Magic Platform can only create rectangular/circular shapes. It cannot have slopes, and it cannot have 'unused space' within the location. All tiles will turn into solid blocks.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When this Event is activated, the Magic Platform will move as specified. Deactivating the event will not deactivate the Magic Platform; it will continue until it has reached the final Path Node.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: When the Magic Platform reaches its final path Node, this Event ID is activated.

value.title: Path ID
value.comment: This determines the ID of the Path that the Magic Platform will be linked to.
value.comment2: If set to 0, the Magic Platform will be stationary.

value.title: Starting Node
value.comment: This determines the Node of the Path that the Magic Platform will appear at and start moving from.

checkbox.title: Bounces
checkbox.comment: This determines if the Magic Platform should reverse direction at the ends of the Path (only applicable if not looping).

value.title: Location ID
value.comment: This determines what the Magic Platform looks like. It will clone the Layer 1 tiles as it sees them within the given Location. This Location does not have to be within the current Zone boundaries.

list.title: Collision
list.comment: This determines the type of collision.

value.title: Z-Order
value.comment: Changes the Z-Order of the Magic Platform to place it behind Layer 2.
value.comment2: Higher values are further behind other Magic Platforms.

sprite.name: Magic Platform - Rotation Controlled
sprite.notes: A rotation controlled platform made out of tile objects.

dependency.notes: It should be noted that the Magic Platform can only create rectangular/circular shapes. It cannot have slopes, and it cannot have 'unused space' within the location. All tiles will turn into solid blocks. A rotation controller is required for the Magic Platform.

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: This pairs the Magic Platform to a matching rotation controller.
value.comment2: If the Magic Platform cannot find the rotation controller, it will not spawn.

checkbox.title: Ignores Rotation Controller Angle
checkbox.comment: This determines if the Magic Platform should always face upwards rather than tilting with the rotation controller.

value.title: Location ID
value.comment: This determines what the Magic Platform looks like. It will clone the Layer 1 tiles as it sees them within the given Location. This Location does not have to be within the current Zone boundaries.

list.title: Collision
list.comment: This determines the type of collision.

value.title: Z-Order
value.comment: Changes the Z-Order of the Magic Platform to place it behind Layer 2.
value.comment2: Higher values are further behind other Magic Platforms.

sprite.name: Effect Spawner
sprite.notes:
Enables event-driven spawning of Sound Effects and Graphic Effects.
Limitations
1) Do not use 1000 or more sounds/effects per area.
2) A single Event ID can only trigger one sound/effect per area
3) Only a specific number of sounds/effects can be active at the same time
4) Only two BRSTMs can be active at the same time.
sprite.advancednotes: If spawning a Sound Effect, the placement of the sprite is crucial, as the sound is emitted from that position. If the player is ~3 screens away from the sprite, then they won't hear it anymore. Placing multiple sprites with the same settings at different locations is possible.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When this Event ID is activated, the associated sound or affect will be played.

external.title: Sfx ID
external.comment: Use this external window to select your Sound Effect.

external.title: Gfx ID
external.comment: Use this external window to select your Graphic Effect.

dualbox.comment: This determines if you are spawning a sound effect or a graphical effect. The volume of the sound effect is relative to the distance of the placement of the spawner.

value.title: Loop Delay
value.comment: This determines the number of seconds between activations of the sound or graphic effect.
value.comment2: The effect will only activate once if the delay is left at 0.

sprite.name: Fake Star Coin
sprite.notes: A Star Coin that will disperse into 4 harmless Boos like a Fake Door when the player attempts to collect it.

dualbox.comment: This determines the way the Fake Star Coin will rotate to differentiate itself from real Star Coins.
dualbox.comment2: It is recommended to keep this consistent across Fake Star Coins.

sprite.name: Model Loader
sprite.notes: This will load a model from the specified bank and brres. Can play any type of animation.

value.title: Resource Bank ID
value.comment: This determines what resource bank to load the model from.
value.comment2: You must place the corresponding resource bank sprite into the level, or else the game will crash.

value.title: BRRES ID
value.comment: This determines what BRRES to load the model from.
value.comment2: The brres with the name of the ID must exist in order, or else the game will crash.

list.title: Lightmap Type
list.comment: This determines what lightmaps to generate.

list.title: Animation playback mode
list.comment: This determines how the model should play it's animations.

list.title: Z-Order
list.comment: This determines the Z-Order of the model.

sprite.name: Model Loader Resource Bank 1
sprite.notes: Place this in the level to load resources necessary for the Model Loader.

sprite.name: Model Loader Resource Bank 2
sprite.notes: Place this in the level to load resources necessary for the Model Loader.

sprite.name: Model Loader Resource Bank 3
sprite.notes: Place this in the level to load resources necessary for the Model Loader.

sprite.name: Model Loader Resource Bank 4
sprite.notes: Place this in the level to load resources necessary for the Model Loader.

sprite.name: Model Loader Resource Bank 5
sprite.notes: Place this in the level to load resources necessary for the Model Loader.

sprite.name: Model Loader Resource Bank 6
sprite.notes: Place this in the level to load resources necessary for the Model Loader.

sprite.name: Model Loader Resource Bank 7
sprite.notes: Place this in the level to load resources necessary for the Model Loader.

sprite.name: Model Loader Resource Bank 8
sprite.notes: Place this in the level to load resources necessary for the Model Loader.

sprite.name: Model Loader Resource Bank 9
sprite.notes: Place this in the level to load resources necessary for the Model Loader.

sprite.name: Model Loader Resource Bank 10
sprite.notes: Place this in the level to load resources necessary for the Model Loader.

sprite.name: Model Loader Resource Bank 11
sprite.notes: Place this in the level to load resources necessary for the Model Loader.

sprite.name: Model Loader Resource Bank 12
sprite.notes: Place this in the level to load resources necessary for the Model Loader.

sprite.name: Model Loader Resource Bank 13
sprite.notes: Place this in the level to load resources necessary for the Model Loader.

sprite.name: Model Loader Resource Bank 14
sprite.notes: Place this in the level to load resources necessary for the Model Loader.

sprite.name: Model Loader Resource Bank 15
sprite.notes: Place this in the level to load resources necessary for the Model Loader.

sprite.name: Model Loader Resource Bank 16
sprite.notes: Place this in the level to load resources necessary for the Model Loader.

sprite.name: Switch ! Block
sprite.notes: A colored !-block that will turn solid upon the activation of the associated Switch Palace and will dispense an item when hit.
sprite.advancednotes: Yellow Blocks give Mushrooms, Red Blocks give Fire Flowers, Green Blocks give Propellers, and Blue Blocks give Ice Flowers.

sprite.name: Switch Palace Switch
sprite.notes: A large !-Switch that will activate a Switch Palace and display a message upon being pressed.

list.title: Switch Type
list.comment: This determines the color of switch and what block outlines will be actived.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will be facing downwards.
checkbox.comment2: Upside-Down switches cannot be set to fall.

checkbox.title: Falls
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will be movable by environmental factors, such as dropping down when bricks below it are destroyed, or moving along platforms.
checkbox.comment2: Conveyor belts cannot move Switches, even when [Falls] is set.

checkbox.title: Loads at Midway
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will only appear if the level has been loaded from a Midway point.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This switch will not be visible if a Triggering Event is defined unless that event is activated.

sprite.name: Magic Platform - Two Way Line
sprite.notes: A Two Way Line controlled platform made out of tile objects.

dependency.notes: It should be noted that the Magic Platform can only create rectangular/circular shapes. It cannot have slopes, and it cannot have 'unused space' within the location. All tiles will turn into solid blocks. A Two Way Line controller is required for the Magic Platform.

value.title: Two Way Line ID
value.comment: This pairs the platform to a matching Two Way Line movement controller.
value.comment2: If set to 0, the Magic Platform will be stationary.

value.title: Location ID
value.comment: This determines what the Magic Platform looks like. It will clone the Layer 1 tiles as it sees them within the given Location. This Location does not have to be within the current Zone boundaries.

list.title: Collision
list.comment: This determines the type of collision.

value.title: Z-Order
value.comment: Changes the Z-Order of the Magic Platform to place it behind Layer 2.
value.comment2: Higher values are further behind other Magic Platforms.
